title.narrative: Asia Pacific Universal Periodic Review Seminar

description.narrative: Funding under this initiative provides administrative assistance for representatives from low income countries to participate in the Asia Pacific Universal Periodic Review (UPR) Seminar to be held in Sydney, 9-10 April 2013. The UPR is a mechanism that examines the human rights records of all 193 UN Member States once every four years. The aim of the UPR process is to encourage States to comply with their international human rights obligations. Participation in the UPR process is a critical element of Australia’s advocacy on human rights issues and we seek to engage actively. The total value of this initiative is $50,000 to be expensed during the 2012-13 financial year.
